page.title: 02A LIFETIME IN ALLESLEY
page.content:
In June 1985 we were visited by Mr.Sumners (87yrs.) and Mr.Taylor (73yrs.) who have both lived in Allesley for all their lives.
Both men had attended the old Victorian village school; this had two rooms and the boys sat at one end of a large room and the girls at the other. If a boy got into trouble he would have to stand by the girls - Mr.Taylor said that someone brought carbide in one day and it started bubbling up from the ink well, he laughed and was sent to the girls' side. The children stayed at the same school until they were fourteen.
When they were young men Mr.Sumners and Mr.Taylor began bell ringing at the church and they still do this today despite the fact that the steps
